document.docAuthor: Sutthinun, Chanaporn, Gattolliat, Jean-Luc & Boonsoong, Boonsatien
document.docTitle: Platybaetis nayokensis Sutthinun & Gattolliat & Boonsoong 2018, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Platybaetis Müller-Liebenau, 1980 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from Thailand, with description of the imago of Platybaetis bishopi Müller-Liebenau, 1980

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Platybaetis Müller-Liebenau, 1980 (Ephemeroptera: Baetidae) from Thailand, with description of the imago of Platybaetis bishopi Müller-Liebenau, 1980

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined: HOLOTYPE : male I (reared from larva, L-SI-I), THAILAND , Nakhon Nayok headwater stream, Wang Takrai ,
Mueang Nakhon Nayok district
,
Nakhon Nayok province
, 14° 19’ 35” N 101° 18’ 23” E , alt.
30 m
,
9-XII-2014
, C. Sutthinun leg. ( ZMKU )
.
PARATYPES : female I (reared from larva, L-SI-I), same data as holotype ( ZMKU ); 7 L and 2 last instar L on microscopic slides
,
same data as holotype ( ZMKU ); 2 mature L (GBIFCH00238457), 1 L on slide (GBIFCH00585171)
,
same data as holotype ( MZL ); 9L, 1 female SI (reared, L- SI),
23-XII-2014
,
same locality as holotype ( ZMKU ); 10 larvae
, 4 female SI (reared, L-SI),
4 male SI (reared, L- SI),
15-II-2017
, same locality as holotype ( ZMKU )
; 6 larvae, 1 female SI (reared, L-SI),
3 male SI (reared, L-SI),
25-II-2017
, same locality as holotype ( ZMKU ).
Descriptions. Larva. ( Figs 3–4 , 21–25 , 27–32 )
Length: Body 6.5–7.2 mm . Cerci 6.0– 6.8 mm , terminal filament 0.16–0.17 mm , antennae 0.80-0.96 mm .

Head. Greyish brown with irregular, poorly visible, darker marking on verteX and frons with 3 black ocelli. Antennae ecru. Turbinate eyes black. Hind margin of head in male and female larvae with no incision.

Right mandible ( Fig. 29 ) incisors with 6 denticles; tuft of setae reduced at the apeX of the mola. Size of the teeth of the mandibles similar to
P. bishopi
,.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 15–16. Forewing (15) of
P. bishopi
Müller-Liebenau
, 1980
male imago (Ratchaburi province), dorsal view; (16) forewing of
P. nayokensis
sp. nov.
male imago (Nakhon Nayok province), dorsal view. Scale bar = 0.5 mm.

FIGURES 17–20. Abdominal pattern (17) of
P. bishopi
Müller-Liebenau
, 1980
male imago (Ratchaburi province), dorsal view; (18) abdominal pattern of
P. nayokensis
sp. nov.
male imago (Nakhon Nayok province), dorsal view; (19) genitalia of
P. bishopi Müller-Liebenau
, 1980
male imago (Ratchaburi province), ventral view; (20) genitalia of
P. nayokensis
sp. nov.
male imago (Nakhon Nayok province), ventral view. Scale bar = 0.5 mm (17–18), 0.2 mm (19–20).

subSubSection.paragraph: Labium ( Figs. 23, 24 , 31 ) with glossae slightly longer than paraglossae; glossa with 2 minute, blunt setae at apeX; one large pointed peculiar seta near apeX ( Fig. 24 ); a few small setae on dorsal margin; apeX of paraglossa with 3 rows of stout setae; palps 3-segmented, segment III globular with numerous short stout acute setae.
Paraproct similar to Fig. 2d in Müller-Liebenau (1980a) , eXpanded, surface with numerous scale and setal bases.
Cerci shorter than the body; paracercus reduced to 1 segment.
Male imago ( Fig. 13 , 18, 20 )
Measurement. Body 6.2 mm ; forewing 7.2 mm .
Female imago ( Fig. 14 )
Measurement. Body 5.7 mm ; forewing 7.1 mm .
Head. Yellowish; scape and pedicel medium to dark brown, flagellum medium brown to ecru.

Etymology. The specific epithet is named after the name of province, “Nayok”, where the type material was collected: Nakhon Nayok province in Thailand (“Nakhon” means city and is used in several province names in Thailand ).
